news_header: Chemical companies are facing demand challenges but are expected to benefit from inventory de-stocking and cost-saving measures.
news_original_title: 4 Chemical Stocks Poised to Outshine Q4 Earnings Estimates
news_text: Chemical companies are anticipated to report mixed results due to ongoing demand challenges in key markets like consumer durables and construction. However, the end of customer inventory de-stocking is likely to provide some relief. Companies such as DuPont, Eastman Chemical, Avient, and Albemarle are expected to outperform earnings estimates, aided by pricing strategies and cost-saving actions. The industry has faced a slowdown in demand, particularly in Europe and China, due to high inflation and economic uncertainties. Despite these challenges, the end of de-stocking and improved operational efficiencies may support better performance in the fourth quarter.
